meanings.definition: A substance used to disperse or scatter particles in a liquid.
meanings.sent1: The dispersants helped spread the medicine evenly in the solution.
meanings.sent2: The scientist added dispersants to the mixture to prevent clumping.
meanings.sent3: The dispersants were like tiny messengers carrying the particles throughout the liquid.
meanings.sent4: Her words acted as dispersants, breaking up the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The dispersants worked like magic, making the liquid clear and transparent.

meanings.definition: Agents that break up oil slicks by emulsifying the oil into small droplets.
meanings.sent1: The dispersants effectively cleaned up the oil spill by breaking down the oil into tiny pieces.
meanings.sent2: Environmentalists use dispersants to minimize the impact of oil spills on marine life.
meanings.sent3: The dispersants danced on the surface of the water, transforming the oil slick into a harmless solution.
meanings.sent4: The dispersants acted as little warriors, battling the oil slick to protect the ocean.
meanings.sent5: The dispersants worked tirelessly, turning the dangerous oil slick into harmless droplets.
